name: The Grievous Requiem - Bard 24 / Fighter 4 / Pale Master 12

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Hello all!

I was looking, four days ago, at the builds hosted on both on older and newer ECB guilds, to see how I could design the first PC to be designed for my solo playthrough in WoG server.
First note: this is to be a bard, but not the bard/fighter/RDD that I have previously played;
Second note: pale master builds have been posted in the forum, and never played one. So, PM as a second class.
Third note: I played a little of offline module as a Bard14/Sorcerer26 ("optimized" with our comments). Bard song, in epic levels and with epic bosses, does not last enough even with "lingering song", and should be saved (even when someone would need it) in "middle" fights in order to have 3/4 songs for the last match. --> need lasting inspiration.

Search after search (as bard/palemaster builds are countless), I only found one of the builds satisfying many of the these requisites: Mourning glory by Kail Pendragon.

Badass build, that's for sure. But I wondered: is it possible to concile an undispellability (from dispels other than Mords) with PM levels? No builds seem to have posted with this aim.

Each of the versions have higher AB than the mentioned build (39 vs 37), almost the same HP (394 vs 399), slightly less saves and -4 AC.
Thanks to bards' and fighter's epic bonus feats, there is more room for great strenght, so damage is better (1d10+27 for halberd, and 1d10+22 for sword'n board version).
However, they are not immune to fire and (most important thing) cannot count on "Epic warding" and "Epic mage armor". the first one is a situational spell, that does not last long and that can be compensating through expertise + bard + course song, that can rise the AC and help it to reach that 70 AC, avoiding as much as possible the enemies' attacks.
The (huge) loss of epic mage armor, I think, is only to be considered as a "minor" chance to cap STR and CON, the only abilities that are worth of maximization here.
Also, a lasting bard song is equal to more uses of curse song, so AB can be often risen.

AC = (two-hander) base 33 + deflection/natural/armor bonus/dodge 5 = 53+ 4 (haste) + 1 (mage armor) + 7 (combined songs) + 2 DEX (situational) = 67*
          (sword and board) base 36 + def/nat/armor bon/dodge 5 = 56 + bonus shield 4 + haste+mage armor+songs+DEX = 74
*can be risen, in WoG, to 71 due to the bracers of shielding (shield AC).

A couple of considerations from my side:
  • Basically, the 12th Pale master level is a free armor skin feat. Trying to reach lv 13, to obtain an energy resistance feat would compromise the "undispellability" from dispels/greater dispellings and "specialization" feats.
  • I thought to remove one of the feats among "improved knockdown" or "improved critical" for "expertise", especially for the 2-hand version. For the "sword and board" version, I can replace bastard sword with scimitar or another slashing weapon, or even with morning star, to remove the "exotic weapon proficiency".
  • I have added craft wand feat only because of WOG server, and I would replace it with Expertise if I had to play an offline module.
  • Weapon specialization and epic version provide 6 damage, enough to compensate the lack of RDD class (at least, for damage). I can max taunt, to raise the AB more.
  • At least in the 2-hand weapon version I could take armor skin, to help AC.
Now on with your comments! :)

posts.content:
I've never played on WoG so some of what I write below might be bad advice.

First I would change the level layout to Bard24/Figh6/PM10 and change the pre-epic spread to Bard16/Figh4 for the APR increase. If you want the AC back you can switch 2 G STR feats for Armor Skin and something else (like ESF: Disc or ESF: Taunt). Change your first level to Bard and the second level to Fighter, the extra skill points are needed in this build.

It's a shame that you only get enough Perform for a level 16 Bard Song but if the extra skill boost isn't worth it on WoG then it should be fine. 1 point in Disable Trap is a lot more useful than that 1 point in Search. 33 UMD is required to use a level 9 scroll without failure, with the +4 skill boost from a level 16 Bard Song you would need 29 base UMD rather than 25. You can move some points from Listen to elsewhere since you can get +30 Listen from Bard spells. I would opt for getting Taunt, although you would have to increase your INT to 16 since bards are pretty skill-starved.

Below is a rough draft for how I would make this build, although some things need tweaking like the level order and skills.
IExp would be a nice addition but it requires dropping either IKD or Toughness. Still Spell can be swapped with Extend Spell, I chose Extend Spell for personal preference. ESF: Taunt can be replaced with another epic feat like ESF: Disc or Epic Fortitude, although some feat shuffling may be required.
Since it's a rough build I didn't bother with a full skill progression, just the final ranks.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Aquarius and Yunim

Firstly I like your build idea. I do have a soft spot for tanky bard builds, and this is one of them.

It looks like this build can do quite a bit, I think either sword & board or two handed would be ok, depending on whether you plan to stand and fight or aim to dish out damage rapidly. There are quite a few nice bastard swords, as you maybe have observed during our last party session, and I can see why you have chosen to go for this as a weapon focus, although in other environments scimitar might be more attractive for the crit range. I can see you have observed a few nice halberds as well. 

Perhaps sword and board has a slight edge with the extra AC (up to +7 with +5 large shield, +8 with +5 tower shield) and other magical properties provided from the shield. A sword and board PM would be hard to kill, and with WS/EWS/UMD you should be able to dish out a bit of damage.

I like Yunim's suggestion for Bard 24/Fighter 6/PM 10 for the extra APR with BAB 26 at lvl 40, particularly if you decide to go two handed. 

If the build aims for 30 Str with WS/EWS combined with bard song/curse song  the extra attack could be useful to do some extra damage, plus a two attack first flurry without having to use haste.

I would recommend getting EWS at level 24, it is extremely achievable with Yunim's split and enhances playability. You could even take EWF/EWS at level 21 with a Bard 15 / Fighter 5 pre epic split with a Fighter 6 level. 

I can see you are trying to rush lasting inspiration, and this seems reasonable to do. Perhaps you can go Bard 15 / Fighter 5 pre-epic, then hit Bard 20 around level 26 for lasting inspiration, then pump up PM to 10 for crit immunity, then take the rest of the bard levels after that?

If you play this on the server (with me hopefully hehe give me those buffs thanks!) I think Yunim's suggestion extend spell would be more valuable on WoG than still spell funnily enough. In my limited experience partying with you, you do rely more on wands in combat than formally casting spells, you can always unequip armor/shield and buff yourself and teammates before battle, then use wands in combat. 

If you insist on casting spells during combat there are a few -% arcanist runes being dropped or sold to merchants on the server. You could socket this into a large shield or something for unimpeded spell casting during combat. 

In a different environment obviously still spell might be more valuable. 

Mick has taught me one doesn't have to worry about arcane spell failure when using UMD with scrolls as a Bard. For casting purposes the UMD of 25 is fine, however but a UMD of 30 could be valuable, not for the reasons that Yunim has posted, but to er... equip certain boots on WoG (Valerfor taught me that one). 

I'm not too fussed about the base lvl 16 Bard Song in the environment we play in funnily enough, mostly for the +5 AC and -5 AC to enemies with curse song, extra perform is nice but will largely do add a little more hp / do little more damage with curse song and add skill points. 

I believe you could take curse song later, when you hit either Bard 11 or Bard 14 (for -2 or -3 AC respectively)

You will get a lot more skill points by taking Bard at level 1, as Yunim has observed, and I would do this and rearrange the feats such as Exotic Weapon Proficiency etc. 

The open lock value point is useful for chests which cannot be opened with the knock spell, and are indestructible. We encountered such a chest in our last party session which my rogue cleric archer opened for the party. However without giving away too much of the mechanics a lot of item bonuses and modifiers are going to be required to open this chest. Some chests when destroyed are scripted to also destroy their contents and I have also encountered this however this chest was openable with the knock spell.

Anyway enough nit picking from me. I like the idea. Hope you found this helpful.


Edit: Oh and I'd suggest more colorful title for your build to showcase it's awesomeness. 

Something like 'The Grievous Requiem' ? :)

Or translate it to Latin or Ancient Greek, given the conversation going on in the Mines of Twin thread and @Stagmeister others can comment on that aspect of the build :) 

"Gravissimum requiem"

Or maybe not :)

The Grievous Requiem! I like it ;)
thank you for your comments!

Provided that the base AC is lower with 10 PM and without Armor Skin, I think I'll go with "sword and board" instead of the "2-hander" version (even if I love halberds....never mind, this will be the idea for other PCs)....
The idea behind the weapon was not only a preference, but also because I have already two builds with bludgeoning damage (mace + warhammer), both in WoG offline and online server, hence the choice of weapons that provide slashing/piercing damage.
This update retains the bastard sword, although I could opt for scimitar and replace the proficiency feat with extend spell (expertise provides that needed AC boost, and the shield does the rest).

Thanks to taunt, the potential maximum AB is increased furthermore.
From level 25 this build has enough perform to sing that lv. 16 bard/curse song without relying on items /this can help freeinfg ring/bracers slot).

The split you all suggested is quite useful, as allows (in addition to the possibility to max taunts with ESF while retaining the same AB) also few HP and skills more, and 1 to fortitude save.
I have updated only the "sword and board" version, however the "halberd" way can be surely chosen (expertise is already there, also

I agree with you Orion, I tend to use wands on fights so still spell is not that useful. I need only to learn the radial quickspell way/use the rod of fast buffing, to free slots for wands.
SpoilerSure, we can team up ;)
I would prefer retaining the ability score, in order to not to penalize AB...maximizing taunt costs the listen skill. Wands/casts of amplify will hopefully help.
I am still unsure on how to take ESF:taunt or epic prowess at lv 39, to maintain the 40 AB.

If you're determined to keep ESF: Taunt over Epic Prowess then I would swap 2 G STR feats for Epic Prowess and Armor Skin. You lose 1 damage but gain 2 AC.
Everything else looks great, although personally I would take Lasting Inspiration at 27 and move the PM levels earlier in order to get PM10 by level 36.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Looks better Aquarius.

Something I forgot is the +6 AC from PM 10 plus the +5 AC from your bard song.

Two handed is therefore very viable.

Add improved disarm for extra situational AB (+8 against a dagger/kukri user, +4 against a shortsword/mace user, no penalties against a medium weapon user), combined with taunt (-6 AC) and bard song/curse song (+2 AB/-5 AC), and you are laughing with effective +21 AB right there against any dagger user.

Even if you don't get bonuses, any non-large weapon user you get free improved disarm attempts with no AB cost to you. 

Disarm them, and with ghostly visage / greater brawlers belt / soak +1/10 etc active any non-monk/creature is just going to tickle you with their fists whilst triggering attacks of opportunity for you to punish them further with your nasty halberd.

Anyway this is what it looks like with a halberd with ID. I kept the Str 30 to boost damage with the halberd, a sword and board version will probably want to follow Yunim's suggestion of Str 28 / EP / AS.

I get EWS faster at 21 (rather than 24). It also incorporates Yunim's suggestion to get LI at 27 (rather than 29), PM 10 at 36 (rather than 39)

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
You could fit epic mage armor and rush lasting inspiration into your build if you:

- drop undispellability (which may not be such a big loss, with your bard/curse song is undispellable, wands, EMA is undispellable/lasts 24hrs, and the fact undispellability is only achieved at level 40) and ESF: Taunt

- drop epic weapon specialization or 1 APR / round (both are reasonable losses, EWS is probably the smaller of the two, 4 damage loss is a hit, but going two handed with capped strength plus damage from bard song mitigates that).

This is an example of how it may be achieved. EMA is taken at lvl 39 which is a bit late, but squeezing everything desirable in is very challenging. 

EMA (+20) combined with PM 15 (8 AC), bard song (5 AC) and tumble 40 (8AC) adds 41 AC to the build, naked. Not counting curse song.

In practice you will usually have +5 armor class or better items equipped so the AC bonus from EMA is usually +5 dodge AC and item flexibility for equipment. 

So it adds 26 AC total to the build naked. May as well equip that halberd now if you want to go down this route.

I usually choose Epic Energy Resistance: Acid for the bonus PM 13 feat due to those pesky mages and their Mestil Acid Sheaths, WebShaman has rightly pointed out to me you should breach / mord them, although we have met an opponent where such an outcome was not erm possible.

This might be stronger, but keen to know what you think.

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Mmmhh I think that, in that build in post #6, AB 40 can be reached by swapping ESF: taunt with epic prowess.
The question is: I have never used taunt in high-highest epic levels, is the ESF needed to have an average chance of success?
(I fear that taunt with big bosses will always fail, but I wait for your denies: would it be a  - even minor - chance in the world to have a successful taunt with ESF?).

Is that less taunt skill better than 1 AB? Or is it the contrary?

Similar questions have come in my mind when reading all the replies:
  • is improved disarm generally better than expertise?
  • to reach for undispellability or aim for epic mage armor + warding?
Having read the thread regarding double base damage, the will to go the halberd route is much more tempting, and the build posted in #6 quite meets my needs: improved disarm, improved knockdown, etc... all feats taken, retains toughness and 30 STR.

But.....there is a but.

With such a build, I would have almost half of the slots full to reach that +20 AC that EMA gives: this means, fewer slots for ability capping (STR+CON).
Furthermore, EMA+16 PM levels would grant +7 AC more than the designed build.
If I had decided to go sword and board, I would have probably chosen the Bard24.fi6.PM10 split, however for a two-hander the bard20/fighter4.PM16 is stronger, as provides more AC and frees more slots for ability capping: CON is a must, more for two-handers than sword and board fighters, as they has less AC than their fellow that equips shield.

This also answers the question I raised in post 1: is it possible to concile undispellability with PM levels?
Yes, you all would reply, but at the cost of:
  • less AC;
  • less CON or STR --> more heals used, less AB/damage;
To go one-hand+sword helps mitigating these negative effects, but they will appear nonetheless.

PM16 should be the way to go. Need to think some time, as I am not fully convinced.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
It depends on what you want to accomplish. A 16 PM build w/ epic warding and epic mage armour is a strong melee build supported with bard spells but, unlike cleric, not dependent on them for survival (AC). The majority of your AC and core immunities are undispellable making it pretty solid even with dispellable bard levels. The bard levels offer some solid Spell convenience, especially if you can wand them.

I do not see bard as a caster build or even an in undispellable hybrid melee build, especially not at the expense of Epic Mage Armor and secondarily Epic Warding. All the bard undispellable spells vs Epic Mage Armour and EpicMage Armour wins in a defensive melee build every time. Add Epic Spell Warding to this is just a cherry on top of the Epic Mage Armour ice cream. Add to this some extra PM AC and any competition remaining drops away.

posts.content:
Taunting Bosses in certain Environments is hard (if they are specially pre-prepared for Taunt resistance).

But not impossible (unless they have been made purposefully immune to Taunting).

Basically, you can get a max of +50 to the skill in bonuses (although this is environment dependent), don't forget the effects of a high level Bard Song/Curse, as well as items that boost Taunt.

For example, I do run a Taunt build that actually uses it quite successfully - albeit not always vs Bosses (having a Bard companion with high Song/Curse is a godsend!)

Just sayin'!
